p: We combined predictions into an “ensemble” by averaging the models with a true skill statistic [ 47] higher than 0.8 to obtain a “consensus model” and to avoid the integration of weak models. The main aim of consensus methods is to decrease the predictive uncertainty of single-models, since predictions of species distributions can vary widely among modeling approaches. Indeed, ensemble forecasting can enable a more robust model and overcome the uncertainties derived from each individual model [ 23].
